intro: Pectis hassleri, commonly known as the Hassler's pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually linear and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Pectis hassleri is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
